Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Rabbit neutrophil defensin 2 (original name MCP-2; NP-2, NP2; Arg-rich; natural AMPs; defensin; 3S=S, UCSS1a; rabbit, mammals; animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Chemical modification:  Three disulfide bridges.Activity: log deduction after 20 min incubation with 50 ug/ml peptide. Active against S. aureus strains 566, 502A, J.F. (reduction 2.4->4.1 logs), S. epidermidis UCLA-622 (reduction >4.1 logs), S. pneumoniae Type III (reduction >3.5 log), S. agalactiae Type I-A or III (reduction 2.0-2.9 logs), L. monocytogenes 450 (reduction 2.1 logs), P. aeruginosa PAO579 (reduction 3.2 logs), E. coli ATCC 29648 (reduction 0.8 logs), K. pneumoniae ATCC 13883 (reduction 1.1 logs), S. marcescens (reduction 1.0 log), H. influenzae Type 3A (reduction 2.1 log), B. bronchiseptica UCLA-342 (reduction 0.1 log).Antimicrobial robustness: pH-sensitive:S. agalactiae; pH-sensitive:L. monocytogenes; pH-sensitive:P. aeruginosa; pH-sensitive:P. aeruginosa; NaCl-sensitive:S. agalactiae; NaCl-sensitive:S. agalactiae; NaCl-sensitive:L. monocytogenes; NaCl-sensitive:P. aeruginosa; NaCl-sensitive:K. pneumoniae. e N0 refers to the initial number of CFU per milliliter and N1, refers to the number surviving after 20 min. NP-2 is effective in directly neutralizing herpes simplex virus type I (HSV-1). Activity is pH-sensitive (little activity at pH 5.8). Ref/activity updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Lehrer RI, Selsted ME, Szklarek D, Fleischmann J. 1983
Literature Information.Title: Antibacterial activity of microbicidal cationic proteins 1 and 2, natural peptide antibiotics of rabbit lung macrophages.
